programme.title: Alien Disclosure Files

programme.title: Mysteries From Above

programme.title: Storage Wars Texas

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence

programme.title: Alien Disclosure Files

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal

programme.title: Strange Evidence

programme.title: News

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: (1989) Harrison Ford and Sean Connery star in the third film in Steven Spielberg's action adventure franchise. Indy must rescue his kidnapped dad and beat the Nazis to the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: (2011) Naughty kids are one thing but a naughty teacher? Can titular educator Cameron Diaz win a big-bucks teaching competition... and buy surgical enhancements to seduce Justin Timberlake?

programme.title: Like a Boss
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy with Tiffany Haddish and Rose Byrne. When two best friends find their beauty business in dire financial difficulty, they turn to a scary CEO for help.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: BSL Zone: Deaf LGBT+ Pride
programme.desc: This episode explores the Deaf LGBT+ community in the 21st century, delving into what it means to be non-binary and explore how the community continues to evolve.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing thriller filmed in a documentary style, starring Bonar Colleano as a sailor whose smuggling activities lead to him being suspected of murder and going on the run.

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers
programme.desc: (1956) Sci-fi thriller. Hugh Marlowe stars as a scientist who discovers Earth is threatened by a fleet of flying saucers bent on global conquest. With special effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea
programme.desc: (1955) Creature feature. Kenneth Tobey stars as the captain of a nuclear submarine who comes across a giant, tentacled beast that is fiercely determined to destroy San Francisco.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: (1952) John Wayne stars in John Ford's comedy as a US boxer, retired to Ireland, who courts the fiery Mary Kate (Maureen O'Hara), despite her brother's (Victor McLaglen) violent objections.

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: (2009) Action adventure with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston. Terrorists steal a devastating weapon and only the USA's finest - the GI Joes - can stop them.

programme.title: Father Stu
programme.desc: (2022) Biographical drama. Mark Wahlberg stars as Stuart Long, a sweary amateur boxer who develops a degenerative muscular disorder and reboots his life as a Catholic priest.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: (2000) Guy Ritchie's crime comedy starring Brad Pitt, Vinnie Jones, Stephen Graham and Jason Statham. Gangs collide when the owner of a stolen diamond arrives in London to sell it.

programme.title: Shoplifters
programme.desc: (2018) Hirokazu Kore-eda's Palme d'Or-winning drama about a family who survive through petty crime, and whose lives are transformed when they take in an abandoned girl. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: (1949) Classic World War II drama. John Wayne stars as a marine sergeant preparing recruits for the American attack on the Japanese fortress island of Iwo Jima.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: (1954) Judy Holliday stars in this comedy as a smalltown girl who comes to New York and rents a billboard to publicise her name - and soon she's a TV star. With Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome

programme.title: Super Bowl LIX Live
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the showpiece match which takes place at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Chiefs are looking to become the first team to win three consecutive Super Bowls after they beat the Buffalo Bills 32-29 in the AFC Championship match. The Eagles hammered the Washington Commanders 55-23 in the NFC Championship match to reach their third Super Bowl in eight years. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Efe Obada, Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell. Rapper Kendrick Lamar provides the entertainment for the half-time show

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.desc: David Dickinson hosts from Aintree Racecourse in Liverpool as sellers aim to get cash offers from dealers for their collectables and antiques or gamble to make more at auction. A bargain buy of old watches snapped up at a car boot sale gets an amazing 1,500 per cent profit, while dealer James Layte splashes out for an extraordinary portrait.

programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which Daniella and Charlotte from London and Nathan and Aarati from Kent take on the reigning Lingo champions and use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Phil from St Helens, Richard from Wolverhampton, Vicky from Northwich and Samantha from Houghton-le-Spring pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Exeter City v Nottingham Forest (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fourth-round tie at St James Park. League One side Exeter reached this stage for the first time in 44 years by winning 3-1 here against Championship outfit Oxford United in the previous round. However, they now face an even tougher test against Forest, who are enjoying an excellent Premier League campaign and won 2-0 at home to Luton Town in round three. With analysis from Ian Wright and Roy Keane, reports by Katie Shanahan, and commentary from Seb Hutchinson and Ally McCoist

However, they now face an even tougher test against Forest, who are enjoying an excellent Premier League campaign and won 2-0 at home to Luton Town in round three. With analysis from Ian Wright and Roy Keane, reports by Katie Shanahan, and commentary from Seb Hutchinson and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Super Bowl LIX Live
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the showpiece match which takes place at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Chiefs are looking to become the first team to win three consecutive Super Bowls after they beat the Buffalo Bills 32-29 in the AFC Championship match. The Eagles hammered the Washington Commanders 55-23 in the NFC Championship match to reach their third Super Bowl in eight years. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Efe Obada, Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell. Rapper Kendrick Lamar provides the entertainment for the half-time show

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: The Architecture the Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits the Ffestiniog in Wales originally built to transport slate from mountain to coast and learns about Amsterdam Centraal.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Entertainment Special: Fiona Bruce presents a special episode from the set of EastEnders celebrating the history of film, theatre, music and television.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases

programme.title: Villages By The Sea
